snippet: A bistate compact made in 1969 clamped down on runaway development, but a new plan should update infrastructure and help restore the lake’s clarity.
abstract: New plan approved by Tahoe Regional Planning Agency ends years of discord between California and Nevada over development of lake's shoreline; plan has broad support in both states, but some environmental groups worry that it will result in taller buildings and denser development, which may harm ecosystem of lake.
lead_paragraph: A bistate compact made in 1969 clamped down on runaway development, but a new plan should update infrastructure and help restore the lake’s clarity.

headline.seo: California and Nevada Update Tahoe Development Plan
headline.main: After Years of Discord, California and Nevada Agree on Tahoe Development
headline.print_headline: After Years of Discord, California and Nevada Agree on Tahoe Development
